message: By repealing the #ACA, House Republicans are replacing care with chaos for millions of Americans. Share your story with me of how you have benefitted from the #ACA so we can remind Republicans what’s at stake. #ACAWorks #ProtectOurCare #PeoplesHouse

Today, I sent a letter to House Speaker Paul Ryan with 58 House Democratic women calling for an end to attacks on women’s health and medical research. Read the full letter here: https://matsui.house.gov/press-releases/matsui-leads-over-50-democratic-women-in-calling-on-speaker-ryan-to-cease-attacks-on-womens-health-and-medical-research/

The forecast for Sacramento anticipates continued rain storms in the days ahead. As always, I encourage all residents to be vigilant and remain aware of information provided by local, state, and federal authorities.  https://www.facebook.com/NWSSacramento/

It was great meeting with Wendy Spencer yesterday, who has served as the leader of the Corporation for National and Community Service throughout President Obama’s administration. CNCS encourages millions of Americans to serve through programs like AmeriCorps. Wendy’s leadership has made an enormous impact on the lives of volunteers and the communities in which they serve. Thank you Wendy!
NA

I joined House Democratic Leader Nancy Pelosi, Jan Schakowsky, members of The Congressional Task Force on Seniors, and advocates today to send a message to House Republicans about the devastating impact an ACA repeal would have on seniors.    Thanks to the ACA, the Medicare Trust Fund is stronger than ever. Medicare enrollees now have lower prescription drug costs, free preventive services, and more coordinated care.   As a Co-Chair of the Seniors Task Force, I will continue to fight back against Republican attempts to devastate the well-being of seniors and their families through an ACA repeal. #ProtectOurCare
NA
This #MLKDay we commit to continuing Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.'s pursuit of love, opportunity, and equality for all. #MLK365

After campaigning on a plan that would leave 32 million without health insurance, President Trump is raising the stakes once again. And this time, his attempt to cut Medicaid could leave 21 million Americans in the cold. https://goo.gl/eaDc7d

Today I spoke on the House floor against H.R. 7, which is just another attempt by House Republicans to restrict women’s reproductive health choices. We will not be silent as Republicans interfere with a woman’s Constitutional right to choose. #WomenAreWatching

Wasting billions of dollars to put up walls and targeting cities protecting the most vulnerable does nothing but sharpen divisions. We should be working to pass comprehensive immigration reform, not pushing through symbolic attacks that drain resources and put a strain on our local law enforcement. The President’s executive actions today blatantly disregard the contributions millions of immigrants make in our communities.    http://www.latimes.com/politics/la-na-pol-trump-immigration-20170125-story.html
Pleased to announce five wonderful Vice Chairs to The Congressional Task Force on Seniors!

I issued the following statement in response to the executive order targeting Muslims and refugees signed by President Trump yesterday:   “A sweeping denial of refuge to families facing persecution and bloodshed abroad is not an effective way to protect our citizens. My first priority is always the safety of the American people, and to be clear, refugees already undergo more rigorous security screenings than any other traveler or immigrant to the U.S.     “President Trump’s decision to target immigrants from Muslim-majority countries goes against the essential right to religious liberty that is a founding principle of our nation.    “We can, and we must, protect Americans while also recognizing the basic humanity of all people.”
I’m cosponsoring the SOLVE Act being introduced today that would rescind Trump’s harmful & immoral #MuslimBan. We must protect our proud immigrant tradition. #RefugeesWelcome
Thank you to everyone who came out to stand in front of the Supreme Court tonight to join Congressional Democrats in demanding President Trump reverse his divisive and harmful executive order!

The Republicans have been saying for 7 years that they have a "better way" for our health care system, but today in the House Energy & Commerce Health Subcommittee, they offered no viable solutions for American families. We must fight to #ProtectOurCare.

Yesterday, House Republicans voted against keeping guns out of the hands of the severely mentally ill. They’re willing to trade the safety of communities for cash from the gun lobby.    http://www.npr.org/2017/02/02/513126985/house-votes-to-overturn-obama-rule-restricting-gun-sales-to-mentally-ill

Special Immigrant Visa holders bravely helped our troops in Afghanistan. We must ensure that when they and their families come to our country to escape retaliation, they are able to settle in our communities safely and with dignity. Today, Congressman Earl Blumenauer and I convened a round table with refugee advocates to discuss ways we can best help these immigrants who have already given so much. Thank you to all of our participants in today's discussion, and for your continued dedication to this important work.

Today, I issued the following statement on FCC Chairman Ajit Pai’s announcement that he will be restricting a federal program that helps provide affordable Internet access to low-income families:   “Weakening this program means a child doing their homework online or researching a school project may be left without the resources they need to succeed. I’m disappointed that Chairman Pai has prioritized attacks on the tools that help so many families compete in our digital economy. Gutting programs that support the most vulnerable Americans is no way to move our country forward and close the digital divide.”
It is disgraceful that Senate Republicans silenced U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren simply because she wanted to read a letter from Coretta Scott King. #LetLizSpeak

Technology plays a role in nearly every sector of our economy, so we need to make sure every citizen can participate in the promise of this new economic landscape. That means expanding access to broadband, bolstering our digital infrastructure and providing innovative job training and education solutions for the American workforce.   Read my full op-ed in The Hill about building a foundation for digital inclusion: http://thehill.com/opinion/op-ed/318393-a-foundation-for-digital-inclusion

I am a Co-Chair of the The Congressional Task Force on Seniors, and I’m committed to fighting on behalf of older Americans. The Seniors Task Force knows that #SeniorsWontBeSilent while Republicans go after the benefits they have earned and depend on. We’ll be standing right alongside them demanding #CareNotCuts

I am in contact with state and local authorities regarding the developing situation at Oroville, and have been assured that Sacramento and West Sacramento are not in danger.  I will continue to monitor developments closely — I urge all residents to do the same and to familiarize themselves with local emergency information and resources.
With my Democratic women colleagues talking about #WhatWomenWant for #ValentinesDay: #equalpay, healthcare, paid family leave & child care - just to name a few!

Speaker Ryan must allow an independent commission to investigate Russia’s influence on our election. #ProtectOurDemocracy   https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/14/us/politics/russia-intelligence-communications-trump.html

I’m holding a community discussion this Monday, February 20 at Sutter Middle School in Sacramento to discuss how we can protect access to health care. The forum will begin at 10:30 AM (doors open at 10:00 AM). Your input will play an important role as I continue to fight for access to health care for all Americans. I hope you can join me!

Thank you to everyone who came out today to discuss health care with me! I'll carry your stories and ideas with me as I continue to fight to #ProtectOurCare in Congress. Please continue to share your stories and ideas with me below.

This February, we celebrate #BlackHistoryMonth, a time when we recognize the extraordinary contributions of African Americans throughout our nation’s history. As we look to the future, we must recommit to the work we have left to do together to ensure every person in this country can look forward to a just and equitable future.
Great to be at today’s WellSpace Health center opening to celebrate an important addition to our region’s health care safety net.
It was great to be at Sac Valley Station for its grand reopening today! The beautifully restored and renovated depot will serve as an important link in Sacramento’s transportation network.
I’m signing on to Congressman Jerry Nadler #ResolutionofInquiry because the American people deserve answers on President Trump's business conflicts and Russia ties.

My guest for the President’s Address to Congress is Cameron, a local teacher at Valley High School whose life has been positively impacted by the Affordable Care Act. Some of Cameron's students from his class shared their ideas with me ahead of tonight’s speech. Thank you for sharing your views and being engaged!

I am deeply troubled to learn that it appears Attorney General Sessions lied under oath. If these allegations are true, he must resign immediately. These revelations only reinforce the urgent need for an independent investigation of senior Trump officials’ ties to Russia. We must follow the facts wherever they lead us. Only an independent, bipartisan investigation can be counted on to hold this Administration and Attorney General Sessions accountable. The American people deserve the truth.

The Republican’s #ACA repeal bill will do nothing but ration care and drive up costs for hard-working families across the country. There is so much on the line today for so many, and Republicans are ignoring what’s at stake for the American people. I will continue fighting to #ProtectOurCare and elevate your stories.
Today, I'm joining House Democrats to wear red in solidarity with a #DayWithoutAWoman. #InternationalWomensDay

We are Live on International Women’s Day to talk about the importance of women in business. #SheMeansBusiness
The Republican #ACA repeal bill is just another attempt by GOP to take reproductive health care choices away from women. I will continue to #StandWithPP. #ProtectOurCare
Thank you Sacramento Asian Pacific Chamber of Commerce and Region Business for having me today, it was great to see so many leaders from Sacramento in our nation’s capital!

The Congressional Budget Office has confirmed that the Republican #ACA repeal bill will lead to 24 million people losing their health insurance in America. The #PayMoreForLess bill will make extreme cuts to Medicaid, which will force states to ration long term care for seniors, mental health services, substance abuse treatment options, and care for vulnerable children in our communities. And the #ACA repeal bill takes money from the Medicare Trust Fund to provide tax cuts for the wealthy, leaving seniors in the cold. The American people deserve better. I will keep fighting to #ProtectOurCare.

Rolling back fuel efficiency standards is dangerous to public health. These standards are saving consumers money at the pump, while reducing carbon pollution and making our air cleaner to breathe.   https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/innovations/wp/2017/03/15/trump-to-pull-back-epas-fuel-efficiency-determination-opening-the-door-for-reduced-standards/?utm_term=.8c38c0bfe68c

This proposal reflects the President’s misguided values. Making massive cuts on the backs of hardworking families will only damage our country’s economic competitiveness. As Congress deliberates on this proposal from the President, I urge my colleagues to join me in fighting for a budget that makes real investments in our nation’s future.  https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/economy/trump-federal-budget-2018-massive-cuts-to-the-arts-science-and-the-poor/2017/03/15/0a0a0094-09a1-11e7-a15f-a58d4a988474_story.html?hpid=hp_hp-banner-main_b-budget-12am%3Ahomepage%2Fstory&utm_term=.00870211b862

Proud to stand with Vice President Joe Biden and my fellow Democrats today in opposition to Republican’s #PayMoreForLess repeal bill, that will mean higher costs and less coverage for the American people. We will keep fighting to #ProtectOurCare!
Reading letters from my constituents always gives me inspiration. Thank you to everyone who has written and shared your stories with me!
I'm fighting to #ProtectOurCare

Yesterday, I met with education researchers from UC Davis who also advocate on behalf of children with disabilities. Kirsten’s daughter wrote me this wonderful letter.Thank you for sharing your stories and passion with me!
The #ACA saves lives. I’ll be voting NO on Republicans’ disastrous attempt to repeal it.
Republicans withdrawing their #TrumpCare bill today is a victory for American families. Thank you to everyone for your calls, emails, and letters. Your voice matters!
I’ll be voting NO on SJ Res 34, which strips away important #broadbandprivacy protections for consumers.

ICYMI: My floor speech in opposition to SJ Res 34. I stand with consumers and their right to #privacy. Corporations should not be able to sell your personal information without your permission. #BroadbandPrivacy  https://www.c-span.org/video/?c4663994/floor-statement-opposition-sj-res-34

We need sustained federal investments in research that will lead to breakthroughs for devastating diseases like Alzheimer’s. Thank you Alzheimer's Association for your work to #ENDAlz and give families hope!

On average, women STILL only make 80 cents to the $ of their male counterparts - this #EqualPayDay we MUST do more to close the pay gap!

Today, the Energy & Commerce Subcommittee on Environment held a hearing on the EPA’s Brownfields program, which helps communities clean up polluted properties. The Brownfields program has had a significant impact on redevelopment in both the Cities of Sacramento and West Sacramento. Funds from the program have facilitated projects like the Warehouse Artist Lofts at the center of Sacramento’s Historic R Street Corridor. We need to keep providing federal funding for this important program that promotes development and job creation, while protecting the environment and public health.
The American people have been clear – it’s time to #DemandAVote and finally reveal President Trump's tax returns.

Congressman Devin Nunes' recusal is an important step. But we need an independent commission to investigate the Trump-Russia connection. #FollowTheFacts  http://www.politico.com/story/2017/04/nunes-to-step-aside-from-russia-probe-236951

It was great to be at the Sacramento Native American Health Center, Inc. yesterday to celebrate its grand reopening! The Affordable Care Act’s expansion of Medicaid is essential for community health centers like SNAHC.
Inspired by my discussion with women leaders today about how we can bring more women into leadership positions in Sacramento.

Happy #EarthDay! Today, and every day, we must continue our efforts to combat climate change and protect our environment. The health and well-being of future generations depend on our nation remaining a leader in curbing carbon pollution.

Happening Now: I’m standing with Energy and Commerce Democrats and FCC Commissioner Clyburn against the Trump Administration’s announcement that they plan to dismantle #NetNeutrality. Without strong net neutrality, we’ll have fast lanes and slow lanes on the internet that create a two-tiered system of access to information. That’s unacceptable, and I will continue to fight for a free and open internet for all.

Across the board, President Trump’s first 100 days have been marked by nothing but broken promises. Instead of creating jobs, he has made it a priority to repeatedly push for a #TrumpCare bill that will increase costs for families. #TrumpCare would be devastating for people with pre-existing conditions, yet House Republicans continue to try and push it through Congress. I will continue to fight this damaging proposal.   https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/02/health/obamacare-patients-preexisting-conditions.html?smid=tw-share&_r=0

House Republicans are planning a vote on #TrumpCare today, putting the coverage of millions of people on the line. I’ll be voting NO.

Honored to have art from Fern Bacon in my office for Sacramento City Unified School District's Art of Compassion project, thanks for sharing this beautiful work!

Great to be at the “The Great Race to Promontory” 150th Anniversary celebration in Old Sacramento today. We celebrated our rich rail history and marked our city’s continued efforts to build transportation networks of the future.
Congratulations to Piper Klinger, the winner of my Congressional Art Competition this year! And thank you to all of the talented students who participated.

The firing of Director Comey makes it more clear than ever that we need an independent investigation of Russian interference in our election. This goes beyond partisanship to the very foundation of our system of government. The American people deserve to know the truth.

Joined Sacramento Metropolitan Air Quality Management District and The California Air Resources Board today to celebrate the deployment of 29 electric school buses that will serve students in the Sacramento region. This is the largest deployment of its kind in the country!
Happy Mother's Day to all of the amazing moms in Sacramento and across the country!

I’m joining my colleagues in the Congressional Asian Pacific American Caucus (CAPAC) and Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders in my district to celebrate the accomplishments and contributions of AAPIs this May. Happy Asian Pacific American Heritage Month!

This is an important and long overdue step in what needs to be an ongoing and independent effort to investigate Trump-Russia ties. Former Director Mueller must have complete independence and the proper resources to carry out this investigation. As we move forward, Congress must continue to follow the facts.  https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/17/us/politics/robert-mueller-special-counsel-russia-investigation.html?hp&action=click&pgtype=Homepage&clickSource=story-heading&module=span-ab-top-region&region=top-news&WT.nav=top-news&_r=0
Today, President Trump's FCC is starting the process to overturn #NetNeutrality. I’ll keep fighting to save your access to a free & open internet.

President Trump’s proposed budget callously neglects the needs of hardworking families and America’s future. Our country won’t become more prosperous by leaving people behind. We must remain a leader in breaking down barriers to innovation, curing diseases, and ensuring that our children and grandchildren have a solid foundation from which to succeed. I will keep fighting for a budget that honors that commitment to the American people.
It was great meeting with NAPABA - National Asian Pacific American Bar Association yesterday. Thank you for stopping by my office!

The Congressional Budget Office confirmed today that millions of families would lose health coverage under Trumpcare. House Republicans passed their reckless bill without listening to their constituents about how harmful it would be, and without an independent analysis of its effects. Now, we learn that the last minute, backroom changes made to the bill right before passage would still leave Americans behind. Health insurance would be ripped away from 23 million Americans, more than $800 billion would be cut from Medicaid, and people with pre-existing conditions and those nearing retirement age would be charged exorbitantly more. #TrumpCare must be stopped.

It was an honor to join my colleagues and community service advocates for today’s ACTION for National Service Act rollout. National Service is an investment in America. Our goal with ACTION for National Service is to have 1 million service members, serving at one time. #ACTION4Service.
This Memorial Day, we honor the brave men and women who have lost their lives defending our country. We will never forget their sacrifices.

Withdrawing from the Paris Agreement puts the future of our country and our world at risk.  https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/31/climate/trump-quits-paris-climate-accord.html?hp&action=click&pgtype=Homepage&clickSource=story-heading&module=first-column-region&region=top-news&WT.nav=top-news

Today, President Trump confirmed that he will withdraw the U.S. from the Paris climate agreement. In doing so, the President is damaging the economic security and environmental health of our communities. Despite his reckless decision to abandon U.S. climate leadership, we must keep fighting to #ActOnClimate and protect our planet so that our children and grandchildren have access to a safe and healthy future.

Yesterday, I heard powerful stories from women veterans in Sacramento. We have come far, but we still have far to go in supporting our women veterans. Thank you to all the women who joined me and for sharing your stories.
11,000,000 lost their homes in the financial crisis. Now, Republicans want to put people at risk again. We must defeat the #WrongChoiceAct.

Every American should be deeply concerned about what we heard in the Senate Intelligence Committee hearing today. We are in the midst of a defining moment for our country and it is critically important that we follow the facts wherever they lead. In addition to the work of special counsel Mueller, we must also have an independent commission to get answers for the American people. The future of our democracy is at stake.
Today we honor and remember the 49 innocent lives lost at Pulse Nightclub, and commit to disarming hate. #OrlandoUnitedDay

I am shocked and saddened by the horrific attack this morning at a practice for the annual Congressional Baseball Game. The bravery of our Capitol Police and all of the first responders saved lives, and we are grateful for their heroism today and every day. My thoughts and prayers are with Congressman Scalise, my Congressional colleagues, their staff, the Capitol Police, and all of those impacted by this heinous act of violence.

Today, we mark the fifth anniversary of the DACA program, which has helped protect nearly 790,000 young people from deportation. Because of DACA, DREAMers have been able to work, go to school, and pursue their American dream. We must protect this critical program.  https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/projects/storywall/american-dreamers/

This week, Senate Republicans continue to keep families in the dark about the #Trumpcare bill they are drafting. This is unacceptable and irresponsible — Americans deserve transparency. I will continue fighting to ensure families’ health care is protected.

Last month in Sacramento, we celebrated the deployment of the largest fleet of zero emission electric school buses in the nation. It’s another great example of Sacramento taking the lead in protecting our environment, improving public health, and boosting our clean energy economy. Watch The California Air Resources Board’s video to learn more!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D4uktVg17AE&utm_content=buffer2b086&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=buffer
NA

The Senate Trumpcare bill released today puts the health and well-being of American families in jeopardy.  Under this legislation, if you are nearing retirement, you would see your costs rise. Seniors and people with disabilities would lose access to nursing home and community-based long term care. And, pregnant women and children would be vulnerable to harmful cuts to their coverage.   To make matters worse, Trumpcare guts protections for people with pre-existing conditions. With this bill, the services families need – from maternity care, to prescription drugs, to mental health services – may no longer be covered.   None of us can predict when we or a loved one might have an unexpected medical emergency, and all Americans deserve the peace of mind to know that they are covered if tragedy or illness strikes.   Democrats will keep fighting against Republican efforts to take away the care and protections that Americans need to keep their families healthy.
NA

The Senate GOP has released a #Trumpcare bill that would take away health coverage and protections for America’s families. Republicans need to be reminded about what’s at stake. Share your story below about how repealing the Affordable Care Act and replacing it with #Trumpcare would be harmful to you and your family. #ProtectOurCare

Today's CBO score confirms that Trumpcare is a cruel bill that will kick tens of millions of Americans off their insurance coverage and force families to pay more for less. Without access to coverage, people will be forced to go without the necessary treatments and medications they need to stay healthy. I urge my Republican colleagues to listen to their constituents and reject this harmful legislation  https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/health-science/imminent-cbo-report-could-prove-pivotal-for-senate-republicans-health-care-bill/2017/06/26/cb8d61e2-59f7-11e7-a9f6-7c3296387341_story.html?hpid=hp_hp-top-table-main_cbosenate-12pm%3Ahomepage%2Fstory&utm_term=.37b05b25f201

With the passing of former Sacramento City Councilwoman Bonnie Pannell, Sacramento lost a tireless advocate, an effective leader, and a dear friend. I am grateful to have had the privilege to work closely with Bonnie over the years. She was an incredible woman and I will miss her dearly. My thoughts are with her family during this difficult time.

Congratulations Piper, for winning this year's Congressional Arts Award competition in California's 6th District, and thank you for stopping by my office yesterday!

Today marks the beginning of my 2017 Facebook photo contest! Submit your favorite high quality photos taken in Sacramento to be considered for the cover photo on my Facebook page. To submit, please send the photo, along with your name, zip code, and where the photo was taken, to matsuiphotocontest@gmail.com. Submissions will be accepted until July 12, 2017. Submitted photos will be posted on my Facebook page. I hope everyone has a happy and safe 4th of July with family and friends today. As we celebrate Independence Day, we honor the dedicated men and women who continue to protect our freedom.
Medicaid is the primary support for 65% of seniors in nursing homes. #Trumpcare would pull the rug out from under them. We must #ProtectOurCare.

Net Neutrality helps ensure that innovators, consumers, and small businesses in Sacramento have access to a free and open internet. These are their stories about why protecting Net Neutrality is important for every American.

Today, Senate Republicans released another version of their harmful Trumpcare bill. This latest bill does nothing to change the basic principles of Trumpcare – higher costs for less care.   It is shameful that Senate Republicans are continuing their assault on Medicaid. Seniors needing long term care, people with disabilities, pregnant women, and children will suffer from cuts under this bill. To make matters worse, the latest amendment from Senator Cruz strips away protections for people with preexisting conditions like cancer, asthma, and depression. I urge my Republican colleagues to put an end to their quest to take away peoples’ care.
Today, Senate Republicans released an updated Trumpcare bill that would take away coverage from millions of Americans. #ProtectOurCare

On the 169th anniversary of the Seneca Falls Convention we recognize the women who led the women’s suffrage movement in our country. Elizabeth Cady Stanton, Susan. B Anthony, and Lucretia Mott are three heroes who led the fight for the right to vote – I’m so glad their statues are represented in our nation’s Capitol. On today’s anniversary their struggle and achievements remind us that when women succeed, America succeeds.

It’s time for us to tackle our toughest challenges with bold solutions. That’s why today, House Democrats released an economic plan that’s a better deal for the American people. We’re calling for investments in our nation’s infrastructure, in apprenticeship programs that open up access to good paying jobs, and in advanced research to unleash innovation. Americans who work hard and play by the rules shouldn’t be crushed by prescription drug costs, student loan debt, or child care costs. Democrats are ready to get to work so the American people have an economic future they can count on.  Learn more here: www.dems.gov/abetterdeal

Today at an Energy & Commerce Committee hearing, I urged the FCC to listen to the American people and stop efforts to eliminate Net Neutrality.

Senate Republicans’ vote this afternoon to blindly advance their repeal of the Affordable Care Act is a reckless political stunt.  Every single version of Trumpcare that we’ve seen will result in millions of Americans losing access to care. This is about peoples’ lives. I urge my Republican colleagues to put politics aside and do what’s right for American families by rejecting Trumpcare. #ProtectOurCare
Attention students: the 2017 The Congressional App Challenge begins today! To enter visit: http://www.congressionalappchallenge.us/ #HouseOfCode

Today, The Congressional Task Force on Seniors and the Democratic Women's Working Group celebrated the upcoming 52nd anniversary of Medicare and Medicaid. These are crucial programs for families that will be at risk under #Trumpcare. We will continue to fight to #ProtectOurCare!

Yesterday, I met with Vincent and his mom Daisy as part of the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation 2017 Children’s Congress. Vincent, thank you for sharing your story with me and being such a great advocate on behalf of people with type 1 diabetes. I’m going to keep fighting for funding for diabetes research and will carry your story with me!

Millions of Americans' healthcare was on the line last night. The American people knew what was at stake and because people raised their voices and shared their stories, the Senate rejected TrumpCare.   I've heard from so many of my constituents about the importance of access to care in their lives – from the mom of a son who has disabilities, to the family whose grandparent is in a nursing home, to the young woman who got an unexpected disease diagnosis and will carry a pre-existing condition with her for the rest of her life.   We cannot roll back all the progress we've made for these families. Now is the time to come together to make improvements to our healthcare system to ensure that it works for everyone.

It was great celebrating Sacramento’s Green City designation today. The funding from this designation will benefit disadvantaged communities, improve our air quality, and position Sacramento as a smart city of the future!

The CBO once again finds that patients will be harmed if Trump gambles with ACA cost-sharing payments. Without this support, premiums will skyrocket. Enough with the sabotage. We need to work together on bipartisan solutions to ensure stability in the marketplaces and take steps that move us forward and improve access to care, not take it away.  http://www.politico.com/story/2017/08/15/cutting-obamacare-payments-would-boost-insurance-premiums-241655

Last month, EPA Administrator Pruitt proposed repealing the Clean Water Rule. This rule protects the drinking water of roughly one-third of Americans.  Eliminating it puts Americans’ access to safe drinking water at risk. It also threatens public health by compromising the cleanliness and safety of the lakes, rivers and streams that we use for recreation.   By putting the safety of these water bodies at risk, the EPA is putting the health of our communities at risk.  That’s why I have joined 100 of my colleagues in telling EPA Administrator Pruitt to stop this reckless repeal: https://seec-tonko.house.gov/sites/sustainableenergyandenvironmentcoalitioncaucus.house.gov/files/documents/8.18.17%20Congressional%20Comment%20Letter%20Rule%20to%20Rescind%20Clean%20Water%20Rule.pdf  If you’d like to submit your comments to Administrator Pruitt about the repeal of the clean water rule, visit regulations.gov here: https://www.regulations.gov/comment?D=EPA-HQ-OW-2017-0203-0001

The story of our country’s progress is inseparably linked to the contributions of millions of immigrants from all over the world. The hard work, ambition, and hope that people have brought to America has propelled us forward since our founding. Today, by heartlessly denying young #DREAMers, the President has turned his back on who we are as a nation. Democrats continue to stand ready in Congress to #ProtectDREAMers and stop President Trump from ripping families apart and denying people opportunities to contribute to our country.  https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2017/09/05/trump-administration-announces-end-of-immigration-protection-program-for-dreamers/?hpid=hp_hp-banner-main_daca-1110a%3Ahomepage%2Fstory&utm_term=.a198ac934ecb

Yesterday, President Trump announced his cruel decision to terminate DACA. Now, Congress must act to protect DREAMers who are contributing in Sacramento and across the country. They are college students, engineers, educators, leaders, and our neighbors. Today, I stood with House and Senate Democrats to call on Congressional Republicans to join us in taking action.
Yesterday, I joined House Democrats to tell the stories of #DREAMers across our country and demand a vote on the #DREAMAct. #ProtectDREAMers
We will never forget the brave first responders and all of those who lost their lives 16 years ago today.
#HispanicHeritageMonth should be a month of action – Congress must pass the #DREAMAct to #ProtectDREAMers.
We’re live at Sacramento State calling for the passage of the #DREAM Act.

Even after people across the country repeatedly rejected #TrumpCare, Republicans are intent on pushing through its most devastating provisions. This latest version would gut protections for people with pre-existing conditions, implement an age tax on older Americans, and make the deepest cuts to Medicaid yet. These cuts will rip coverage away from seniors and people with disabilities needing long term care, low-income women and children, and those relying on mental health and substance abuse services in my district.   We should be working together to stabilize our insurance markets and extend critical funding for the Children’s Health Insurance Program and Community Health Centers. Instead, Republicans have put forth a piece of legislation that puts patients last. I urge my Senate colleagues to reject this harmful Graham-Cassidy bill and work with us to improve our healthcare system.  https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/wp/2017/09/18/the-new-gop-health-care-measure-goes-further-than-the-failed-one/?utm_term=.2aa27b151dc0

Yesterday, I had a great meeting with Elica Health. Elica is providing high-quality, affordable healthcare in Sacramento. I'm going to keep fighting in Congress to ensure that Community Health Centers like Elica continue to receive the funding they need to serve our community.

Stood with patients, hospitals, clinics, and health advocates today in Sacramento against #GrahamCassidy #Trumpcare bill. Under this bill, an estimated 6.7 million Californians will have their coverage put at risk. #ProtectOurCare

Thanks to everyone who attended my roundtable yesterday to discuss the need to make robust investments in our healthcare workforce, especially as our population ages. I sponsor the Geriatric Workforce and Caregiver Enhancement Act in Congress, which would incentivize increased funding for workforce training and family engagement.

Visited SMUD Power Academy today to see its utility apprenticeship program in action. At the California State Railroad Museum to talk about Museum Day Live happening here tomorrow, 9/23. Learn more at smithsonianmag.com/museumday.

Last night, I signed a petition to bring the DREAM Act to the House Floor and provide a permanent solution to allow DREAMers to remain in our country. If a majority of Members sign the petition, the House will be forced to vote on the DREAM Act. I urge Republicans to join this effort so we can protect DREAMers now.

Our entire nation grieves with the people of Las Vegas. My heart goes out to the victims, their families, and all of those experiencing unimaginable pain and loss in the wake of this horrific act of violence. We pray for the recovery of those who were injured and send them our strength. We must come together and take action to put an end to these senseless acts of gun violence in our country.

A bill I co-author, the Early Hearing Detection and Intervention Act, passed the House today. This legislation supports a program that ensures infants have access to hearing screenings at birth, so parents can make informed choices about their care management early on. This is critically important, given that so much of a child’s development happens in the first few years of their life. I’m pleased that through the passage of this legislation, the newborn screening and intervention program can continue to improve health outcomes for kids.
Congress must pass commonsense gun violence prevention legislation. Today I stood with House Democrats to demand action. #EndGunViolence

President Trump’s roll back of the Clean Power Plan is damaging to public health, the environment, and our global leadership on climate change. #ProtectCPP  http://www.politico.com/story/2017/10/10/trump-moves-to-cancel-landmark-obama-climate-change-rule-243636

Combating the opioid crisis will take a comprehensive approach. Today in the Energy & Commerce Committee, I called for more resources toward the entire spectrum of addiction, from prevention to crisis care. We need to provide training for state and local law enforcement, bolster our mental health workforce, educate the public on what they can do to prevent or react to a crisis, and address the availability of a range of treatment options. And, we need to protect the expansion of Medicaid through the Affordable Care Act, which increased access to treatment for people with substance use disorders.

Today's Executive Order from President Trump is another attempt to sabotage the #ACA and rip protections away from Americans. Association Health Plans sold across state lines won’t be subject to essential health benefits requirements, which means people will be left with bare-bones plans that don’t provide coverage for basic services like hospital visits. #ProtectOurCare  https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/health-science/trump-to-sign-executive-order-to-gut-aca-insurance-rules-and-undermine-marketplaces/2017/10/11/40abf774-ae97-11e7-9e58-e6288544af98_story.html?hpid=hp_hp-top-table-main_aca-execorder-615am%3Ahomepage%2Fstory&utm_term=.d9c50e7eb1d8

October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month. One in eight women in the U.S. will be diagnosed with breast cancer in her lifetime. I stood with my colleagues today to help spread awareness, and am committed to ensuring people have the tools and resources they need to fight this terrible disease.

Open enrollment for health insurance through Covered California begins on Nov. 1, 2017, and will end on Jan. 31, 2018. You can find plans with no-cost preventive care for services like cancer screenings and vaccinations, and you may be eligible for assistance with paying your premium. To get covered during open enrollment, visit www.coveredca.com.
I voted NO on the #GOPBudget today, which fast tracks tax cuts for the wealthiest at the expense of Medicaid, Medicare, and more.
Tomorrow is the first day of the Open Enrollment period, visit http://coveredca.com  and #GetCovered!

For months, House Republicans have delayed action to fund CHIP and Community Health Centers. These programs are critical in our communities and cannot survive without this funding. They have always been bipartisan, but unfortunately the legislation that is before us today in the House is not. Instead of working with Democrats, Republicans have focused on Trumpcare and sabotaging the ACA. Now, they’ve put forward a bill full of poison pills that will only further delay funding these critical public health programs.

Families in Sacramento can’t afford the Republican tax plan that was released today. It gives tax cuts to billionaires and corporations at the expense of the middle class. It drains our budget, just so Republicans can turn around and rip away benefits from middle class families, seniors, people with disabilities, and children who rely on Medicare and Medicaid for their health and economic security. And it guts the state and local tax deduction, which will cripple California. We should be working on tax reform that puts the American people first.

Families struggling with high medical costs shouldn’t have to worry about their taxes going up. Yet, the Republican tax plan introduced last week would repeal the Medical Expense Deduction, which would lead to a massive tax increase for individuals living with expensive illnesses – like cancer, Alzheimer’s, or a rare disease. This is all so the GOP can give a tax break to the wealthiest and corporations. That is unacceptable.   https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/economy/they-spent-years-planning-to-live-with-alzheimers-disease-the-gop-tax-bill-threatens-those-plans/2017/11/04/83ac1ffa-c098-11e7-8444-a0d4f04b89eb_story.html?undefined=&utm_term=.e1e385bc9b70&wpisrc=nl_headlines&wpmm=1

Today I met with advocates who are working with the UC Davis MIND Institute and other local partners to ensure that people with developmental disabilities have the chance to live full and productive lives. Many adults with disabilities rely on Medicaid not only for health care, but for support to become and remain employed in their communities. Thank you for coming by my office and sharing your stories!
The GOP tax plan gets rid of commonsense deductions that the American people rely on. Middle class Americans shouldn’t be punished so that the mega-rich and corporations get a break.

Speaking out against the harmful House Republican tax bill today in Sacramento.
Honored to join veterans and their families today in Sacramento to celebrate their service to our nation. Thank you for all that you have done to defend our freedom and keep us safe.
Despite the Trump Administration’s attempts to take us backwards, we stood together today to say we’re #StillIn to support global climate action. #ActOnClimate

Today, House Republicans will vote on a GOP tax bill that harms middle class families in order to give a tax break to the wealthiest and corporations. My speech on the House floor yesterday against this #GOPTaxScam.

House Republicans just voted for a tax bill that pulls the rug out from under families in California and across the country.  As young people are struggling to afford college, Republicans have voted to eliminate their student loan interest deduction. As teachers are working every day to create opportunities for the next generation, Republicans have voted to eliminate their deduction that helps them purchase supplies for the classroom. As young families are looking to buy their first home, Republicans have voted to limit their mortgage interest deduction. As seniors and people with chronic illnesses are planning their long term care options, Republicans have voted to eliminate their medical expense deduction.  The list goes on and on. Now, after voting to drive up the deficit, House Republicans are going to go after the earned benefits, like Medicare, that my constituents rely on. That is shameful.  This is all so President Trump and Republicans can take a legislative victory lap. I urge the Senate to reject this tax scam and instead focus on how we can work together to give the American people a better deal.

Today, FCC Chairman Ajit Pai announced a proposal to roll back net neutrality protections. The internet must remain an open marketplace where everyone has the opportunity to participate. Rolling back net neutrality protections will undermine the ability of American consumers and businesses to innovate and compete on a level playing field online. My constituents and Americans across the country deserve to know that internet content will be treated equally, and I will continue to fight in Congress to ensure that it is.
Wishing everyone a joyful Thanksgiving!
